THE

BEST OF 2018

Best Books

  • The Essex Serpent
    by Sarah Perry

    Set in London and an Essex village in the 1890's the novel has a great plot and develops the characters really well. I also loved the themes that appear in the novel and the way they are combined: science vs faith, friendship vs love, feminism, medicine and much more.

  • Love's Executioner and Other Tales of Psychotherapy
    by Irvin D. Yalom

    A collection of ten tales by psychotherapist Irvin D. Yalom and his pacients. The subject in the ten tales vary a lot and may affect the reader in different ways based on the experiences each of us lived.

  • Blindness
    by José Saramago

    Haven't really read much dystopian books. This one was a really page turner, despite the writing style that is not really friendly. A city hit by a blindness epidemic and before we know, we are immersed in a world of hopelessness, violence and hate.

  • One Hundred Years of Solitude
    by Gabriel García Márquez

    The story walks us through seven generations of the Buendia family. Taking events from ordinary life and inserting elements of fantasy this book is one of the pioneers of magical realism.

  • Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
    by Yuval Noah Harari

    This book covers a lot of knowledge related to the history of humankind. I would have loved to have a book like this in the high school, cause most certainly my passion for reading and history would have been much higher.

Best Movies

  • Human Planet
    Year: 2011

    Wonderful! A TV series composed of 8 episodes that explores the life of humans in the most extreme conditions. The movie takes you on a journey in every possible habitat, where surviving seems impossible, but somehow the man adapted to the conditions.

  • Bohemian Rhapsody
    Year: 2018

    There are not many movies that I go to the theather to watch, but I'm so glad I did see the movie there. When the movie ended I had the exact same feeling after a live concert.

  • Benny & Joon
    Year: 1993

    A little love story between a mentally ill young woman and a crazy man played brilliantly by Johnny Depp. I had a really good time watching this. Oh, and the song from the beginning of the movie is so awesome: I'm Gonna Be (500 Miles)

  • Starship Troopers
    Year: 1997

    I watched this movie while visiting my friends in Spain. They described it to me as a combination of teenage romantic movie with an interstellar battle: mankind against a killer specie of insects. I couldn't resist it.

  • Fried Green Tomatoes
    Year: 1991

    A gifted group of actors delivering a good drama where friendship is celebrated. Not everyone's cup of tea, but I really loved the atmosphere in the movie. So 90's, so good.

Best Music Artists

  • Isaac Gracie

    By far the best discovery of the year in terms of the music. Such an awesome voice and such a great first album for him. Quite sad that I missed him this year when he was in Romania for the Summer Well festival.

  • The Mono Jacks

    The only group from Romania to make it in the top 5. I think no other band in Romania at the moment can sing and transmit the level of emotions they do. They've been to Cluj a few times this year and I'm glad to see their music being appreciated.

  • God Is an Astronaut

    An Irish band formed almost 20 years ago, but I've just found them. Never would have thought that I could enjoy songs without lyrics the way I did with this group. It's like you travel to other dimensions while listening to them.

  • The National

    Again another rock band with 20 years of activty behind. Even if I heard about them before I never gave them a chance. I'm glad I did now. Not the type of band to produce any big hits however. I don't have any problem with this, just that it's not everyone's cup of tea.

  • Valeria Stoica

    An indie artist from Moldova. Apart from the great voice she also has a lovely style, so different of everything that has success nowadays. She is so young and if she keeps up the good work, it's just a matter of time till her music will be even more recognized than it is now.

Best Songs

  • The Mono Jacks - Infinit

    So simple and so deep at the same time. I almost shiver while listening to this emotional song even after playing it for countless times.

  • The National - Guily Party

    This got to be my favorite break up song now. I love how the lyrics describe a relationship that gets to the end, without blaming any of the two parties in particular. I recognized myself in some of my relationships that didn't work in the past.

  • Joan Baez - Diamonds and Rust

    Only a melancholic person like would have picked this song in a top. The song was released in 1975 and it's about the relationship that got to an end between Joan Baez and Bob Dylan. It's so poetic and so deep.

  • Wolf Alice - Don't delete the kisses

    The song has a special charm even if it seems quite simplistic. The delicate way in which the verses are delivered together with the music video, is building some erotic tension.

  • Cruel Youth - Hatefuck

    Another break up song makes it in the top. The message is very direct and I think it describes perfectly when in love we hit the bottom.

Best Youtube Videos

  • The Broccoli Tree: A Parable

    So much quality in this vlogbrothers channel. And this video is one of the best. Amazing how you can deliver an amazing story in just 4 minutes. And how a tale about a tree can touch you on some emotional level.

  • 4.1 Miles

    A coast guard captain on a small Greek island that is saving thousands of refugees from drowning in the sea. I still hear a lot of people talking shit about refugees and it hurts me to see such a lack of tolarance. They should really see this one.

  • How David Fincher Hijacks Your Eyes

    I love movies. And I love video essays on youtube. This video brings the two together. An intense video explaining the methods used by one of the best movie directors in creating a connection between the viewer and the actors.

  • Why You Don't Want To Go Viral

    Quite a clickbait name here. But such a good message behind it, sharing some lessons on why hitting a big success in your career can create a terrible environment for being creative in the future.

  • Ten Meter Tower

    A psychologycal experiment that caputers the people facing a difficult situation. The scenario was created by putting the people in front of a high dive test.
